title: Designing AIED Application Strategies for Higher Education Language Domains

context.prior_knowledge: Teaching experience in secondary education settings and basic digital literacy
context.additional_context: Smartphone-based learning environments requiring strengthened competency in utilizing AI tools for language education.

learning_goals: Based on AIED (Artificial Intelligence in Education) ethics principles (fairness, transparency, accountability, etc.), participants will draft a language education design framework and submit a revised version incorporating ≥3 of 5 feedback items from peer reviews and expert evaluations.

Participants will select ≥2 AI tools for language learning (e.g., automated writing evaluation systems, ChatGPT) and develop a three-stage instructional design strategy: ① tool functionality analysis → ② language learning activity design → ③ evaluation rubric development. In peer feedback sessions, the strategy must achieve ≥80% ratings in ≥2 of three feasibility criteria: technical suitability, learning effectiveness, and practicality.

For AIED professional development, participants will propose ≥3 institutional support measures (e.g., customized training programs, mentoring systems, research funding) and achieve an average ≥4.0 on an institutional feasibility evaluation rubric (5-point scale).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
